@graph.name: Using Smart Tag Filters in OptizenAI
@graph.description: Learn how to use smart tag filters to quickly find and manage specific tags in your store. This tutorial demonstrates advanced filtering techniques to organize and optimize your tag pages more efficiently.

about.name: Smart Tag Filtering
about.description: Advanced tag management and filtering techniques for e-commerce optimization

@graph.transcript: In this tutorial, we'll explore how to use smart tag filters in OptizenAI to efficiently manage your store's tags. First, navigate to the tag management section. Then, use the filter options to sort by tag type, performance metrics, or creation date. Apply multiple filters to narrow down your results and find exactly what you need.

@graph.headline: Using Smart Tag Filters - OptizenAI Documentation
@graph.description: Complete guide to using smart tag filters in OptizenAI for efficient tag management and store optimization. Includes video tutorial and step-by-step instructions.

@graph.name: How to Use Smart Tag Filters in OptizenAI
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to using smart tag filters for efficient tag management and store optimization.

supply.name: OptizenAI Account
supply.description: Active OptizenAI subscription with tag management access

supply.name: Store Data
supply.description: Existing tags in your connected store

step.name: Access Tag Management
step.text: Navigate to the OptizenAI dashboard and click on the Tag Management section.

step.name: Open Smart Filters
step.text: Locate and click the 'Smart Filters' button in the top toolbar of the tag management interface.

step.name: Select Filter Criteria
step.text: Choose your filtering criteria such as tag type, performance metrics, creation date, or optimization status.

step.name: Apply Multiple Filters
step.text: Combine multiple filter options to narrow down your results and find specific tags that meet your criteria.

step.name: Review and Manage Results
step.text: Review the filtered results and perform bulk actions or individual tag optimizations as needed.

@graph.name: Smart Tag Filters Learning Resource
@graph.description: Comprehensive learning resource for mastering smart tag filtering in OptizenAI.
assesses: Ability to efficiently locate specific tags

mainEntity.name: What are smart tag filters in OptizenAI?

acceptedAnswer.text: Smart tag filters are advanced filtering tools that help you quickly find and manage specific tags in your store based on various criteria like performance, type, creation date, and optimization status.

mainEntity.name: How do I combine multiple filters?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can combine multiple filters by selecting different criteria simultaneously. The system will show only tags that match all selected filter conditions, helping you narrow down results precisely.

mainEntity.name: Can I save my filter settings?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can save frequently used filter combinations as presets for quick access in future sessions. This feature helps streamline your workflow and maintain consistency in tag management.
Available filter criteria include tag type, performance metrics, creation date, optimization status, traffic data, conversion rates, and custom tag attributes specific to your store setup.

mainEntity.name: How do smart filters improve efficiency?

acceptedAnswer.text: Smart filters reduce the time spent searching through large tag collections by allowing you to quickly locate specific tags based on your optimization goals, performance requirements, or management tasks.

@graph.releaseNotes: Enhanced smart filtering capabilities with improved performance metrics

hasDefinedTerm.name: Smart Tag Filters
hasDefinedTerm.description: Advanced filtering system that allows users to search and organize tags based on multiple criteria including performance, type, and metadata.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Tag Management
hasDefinedTerm.description: The process of organizing, optimizing, and maintaining SEO tags across e-commerce platforms for improved search visibility.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Filter Criteria
hasDefinedTerm.description: Specific parameters used to narrow down tag results, such as performance metrics, creation date, or optimization status.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Bulk Operations
hasDefinedTerm.description: Actions that can be performed on multiple tags simultaneously, such as optimization, deletion, or status updates.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Performance Metrics
hasDefinedTerm.description: Data points that measure tag effectiveness including traffic, conversion rates, and search rankings.
